head.title: Man Accused of Murder Of His Estranged Wife

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New Jersey

hedline.hl1: Man Accused of Murder Of His Estranged Wife

abstract.p: Michael Wester of Brick Township, NJ, is arrested and charged with murder of his estranged wife, Juanita Wester, whose body was discovered hours earlier in truck of her car on street in Paterson (S)

block.p: A Brick Township man was arrested yesterday and charged with the murder of his estranged wife, whose body had been discovered hours earlier in the trunk of her car on a street in Paterson, county prosecutors said.

The man, Michael Wester, and his wife, Juanita Wester, had a history of domestic violence, according to a statement by E. David Millard, the Ocean County Prosecutor. On Wednesday, Mrs. Wester's family reported her missing after she failed to return to her home in Lakehurst, Mr. Millard said. The police in Paterson discovered Mrs. Wester's car yesterday while on a routine patrol and found her partly clothed body inside the trunk, the statement said.

A Brick Township man was arrested yesterday and charged with the murder of his estranged wife, whose body had been discovered hours earlier in the trunk of her car on a street in Paterson, county prosecutors said.

The man, Michael Wester, and his wife, Juanita Wester, had a history of domestic violence, according to a statement by E. David Millard, the Ocean County Prosecutor. On Wednesday, Mrs. Wester's family reported her missing after she failed to return to her home in Lakehurst, Mr. Millard said. The police in Paterson discovered Mrs. Wester's car yesterday while on a routine patrol and found her partly clothed body inside the trunk, the statement said.
A Passaic County medical examiner conducted an initial autopsy and determined that Mrs. Wester's death was most likely a homicide, Mr. Millard said.
